revised_title: Assessing Long-Term Effects of Oil Pollution on Marine Benthic Ecosystems
tldr: This article discusses the challenges of assessing the long-term effects of oil pollution on marine benthic ecosystems. It highlights the importance of understanding biological interactions, different types of biological stability, and the unpredictable timescales involved in detecting subtle changes caused by oil pollution. The author emphasizes the need for increased ecological awareness and research on sublethal effects to better understand the impacts of oil pollution on marine life.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Marine Ecology
